name: Stephen MacLean

roles_in_work.title: Peter Allen: the boy from Oz

biography: Stephen MacLean (1950 â€“ April 2006) was  Australian screenwriter, journalist, broadcaster, and director of films and television series. His best known work is a biography of Peter Allen which was adapted to create the hit musical The Boy from Oz, and wrote the script of the 1982 semi-autobiographical film Starstruck. He was also an amateur musicologist, with extensive knowledge of the songs and the singers of the mid-20th century, and worked with many musicians.
